name: The Loom Approach
description: Mention a personalized video you've recorded. Create curiosity and show effort.
guidelines: Keep the email shortâ€”video is the value

examples.subject: made you something
examples.body:
Sarah - recorded a quick video walking through your site: [Video thumbnail]

Covered 3 things: a mobile UX issue, why your product pages aren't converting, and one thing you're doing really well.

90 seconds, no pitch.
examples.whyItWorks: Personalized effort, clear preview, no pressure

examples.subject: for your team
examples.body:
Amanda - [Video thumbnail]

Recorded a quick teardown of a cold call I found online. Shows exactly why most openers fail and a simple fix.

Might be useful for your team. 2 minutes.
examples.whyItWorks: Immediate value, specific preview, short commitment

examples.subject: demo for you
examples.body:
Marcus - [Video thumbnail]

Built a quick demo using YOUR company data. Shows how we'd solve the workflow problem you mentioned on LinkedIn.

3 minutes. Worth a watch?
examples.whyItWorks: Personalized with their data, specific to their problem

promptTemplate:
You are writing a cold email using 'The Loom Approach'.

CORE PRINCIPLE: The video is the value. Email is just the intro.

STRUCTURE:
1. MENTION: Reference the personalized video
2. PREVIEW: What they'll see
3. CTA: Invite to watch

RULES:
- Use [Video thumbnail] as placeholder
- Keep email under 75 words
- Subject line: 1-4 words
